comment:
> [[ Previous Threads ]]
http://suptg.thisisnotatrueending.com/archive.html?tags=Broken%20Sky
> [[ Unique Identifier: Ascheritte ]]
http://pastebin.com/pZv3XUPQ
> [[ Twitter ]]
https://twitter.com/BrokenSkyOnline
> [[ Ask Page ]]
http://ask.fm/Sylvetican

> Smith, Liza, Vyx, Nel, Tatsumaki, Ayla, Florica, and Aelriss are online.
> Vision and Donnel are offline.

You’ve since resolved to rendezvous with Crow and the others at the nearest entrance to Tethiss’s Claw, high above. You’ve equipped some different gear, as well – trading out what of your equipment suffered the curse to whatever else you have on hand. Currently, you wield your old scimitar and wear leather boots; additionally, you slide the earthsea royal signet ring onto one of the fingers of your right hand, feeling a momentary humming in your mind upon doing so.

Thus, you depart up the slopes from the Calamity Rift.

“I’m not convinced.”

There’s a long, deliberate stall. You pause in your tracks and look over your shoulder at Freya, who cocks an eyebrow at you, folding her arms.

“You’re not convinced about what, now?” She asks.

“You’re inviting me to join Freakshow, and I’m not really feeling the pitch.” You respond, giving a dismissive gesture. “You haven’t really told me why I should get involved with you – just why I shouldn’t get involved with the Alliance. You’re not lacking confidence, are you?”

“What? Never.” Freya responds. “I’m marketing to my target audience – you just happen to be a hard sell. How else could someone rub shoulders with the likes of both the Guardians and the Writ Keepers and remain guildless? I merely didn’t want to waste time feeding you impertinent information. But, if you prefer…”

“That’s enough. What does your guild actually want to achieve?” You ask. “Because orchestrating an attack on Averron City was not exactly what I’d call good PR.”

“That was a regrettable incident, yes.” She looks unperturbed. “Anaximander was rather heavy-handed in his approach – though he wanted to make a statement, and was rather successful in doing so. To be quite honest? I’m not even sure I understand now what he once hoped to achieve. The fact of the matter, though, is that we’ve secured peace.”
name: BSO
subject: [[ Broken Sky Online Quest - Session 29 ]]

comment:
>>980053

“You’ve secured peace?” You shoot her an incredulous look.

“Averron at large now knows the consequences of player-versus-player combat. They understand how to conduct themselves in matters where the Nameless are concerned,” She glances at you with a grin. “Most important, though, is that they have someone to fear.”

She scoffs when your expression doesn’t change. “No one wants to hear the truth,” she continues. "You must admit: what we represented then does well now to keep the population of this place away from each others' throats."

“Peace in Averron is tenuous at best.” You respond. "Still."

“Is that the way you see it?” Freya asks. “From my point of view, things have been rather stable. In fact, the only one who’s made a power play thus far is Liza.”

You shake your head. You don’t really have a lot to say to that one. An icy tingling runs across the back of your head from ear to ear a moment later, indicating that your Artifact is once again ready for use. It’s an exhausting climb, but the mouth of the cave you departed from to this deep, hellish branch of the Underground is just a ways further overhead. You think you can hear voices...

How will you pass the last of the time?

> Allocate a different Memory to Strife Memoriam.
> Message someone. (Who?)
> Say something. (Write-in.)
name: BSO

comment:
>>980128
>>980162

Visions of years spent in exile torment your mind as you meditate on the power of Strife Memoriam. Your teeth grit instinctively, and tears well up in your eyes. In a mere instant, you offer your whole self – years of your life – to serve a kingdom that, in the end, condemns you to death as punishment for your grace.

Your hand tightens into a fist. Your sword is inexorable. Someone will pay.

> With the Memory of Exile, temporarily ignore penalties to movement speed and offensive ability caused by status effects and physical states (such as prone or climbing) unless completely dismembered.
> Exit this state prematurely by shaping remaining Celestial power into single-use melee weapon. Explosion may harm the user.
> Strife Memoriam remains inactive for a short time after reallocating equipped Memories.

> [[ Continued ]]
name: BSO

comment:
>>980098
>>980138
>>980145

“We’re nearby,” Freya says, looking to you suddenly. “I believe I can hear them in the distance. Are you alright?”

“Yeah.” You respond, shaking your head. “I was wondering – why did you join Freakshow?”

“I had aspirations – but like you, I also had doubts.” Freya gives a long pause, then a bit of a sigh. “These opportunities that the elite have access to in Averron? I wanted to partake. But as you’ve seen yourself, it’s not a matter of merit to do so – merely luck and proper connections. And I was downtrodden by the Crimson Guardians and their hegemony; I wasn’t right for them, allegedly. So I had no place to call my own, a fate I wouldn’t wish on anyone.”

“Then?”

“He saw my potential.” She says, giving you a flat look. “Of course, I didn’t disappoint. I became his second in command – discerned the method behind his madness – and when he quit, no one was more suited to take the helm.”

“Your guild widened the gap between Nameless and Identified.” You shoot her a bit of a glare. “You’re right that I’m not a fan of the Alliance’s methods, but I’m hoping to get us all to work together in the interest of unity – which I have a feeling is going to be very important with us coming into contact with more cities.”

“Our actions have always been in the interest of equality, Ascheritte. Though some choose to look down upon us for playing by the rules that this game has already set in place.” She says, extending a hand to help you up the next set of rocks; you accept, though mentally double-checking to ensure it’s her right hand. “We are leaders, you know, but some in Averron are not content with mere leadership. They are not interested in creating unity,” Freya continues, “They are interested in deciding what unity represents.”

> [[ Continued ]]
name: BSO

You cross over the lip of the cliff face, unsteady on your feet – though much more than in your dealing with cursed boots.

> [[ Underground: Lower Averron – Tethiss’s Claw // PVP Enabled ]]

It’s quiet here. The mouth of the cave, which looks rather menacing from this side (knobbed and jagged stalagmites like chelicera at either end, inviting you into the poisoned bite of a fanged maw), is a short distance ahead. It’s dark within, though you can see rock shapes and spiderwebs illuminated faintly by bioluminescent flora along the walls and ceilings – and the silhouettes of humanoids, approaching in the distance.

> [[ UI Messenger – Nel ]]
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Oh, you know, the usual.
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Hanging out with Freya. You know, from Freakshow?
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: We’re besties now.
> [[ Nel ]]: wat
> [[ Nel ]]: you’re joking right?
> [[ Nel ]]: …please tell me you’re joking
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: I am.
> [[ Nel ]]: oh thank god
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: We’re not besties.
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: I am with her though.
> [[ Nel ]]: ashe pls.
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: I have a totally good reason. You missed a lot of stuff.
> [[ Nel ]]: …how much could I have possibly missed?

> [[ UI Messenger – Aelriss ]]
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Yo, is that you guys in the cave up ahead?
> [[ Aelriss ]]: What?
> [[ Aelriss ]]: Oh, wait, shit!

“ASHE!” Someone shouts from a great distance in front of you – and you see one of the shadows crack a fluorescent torch to light. It’s your group: Aelriss, Tatsumaki, Smith, and Crow, all looking a little bit worn down – well, Tatsumaki looks a little angry, and the others look a bit worn down. You and Freya wait in the light, and the four of them pick up the pace a bit to meet you.

“Scrapbook! Lady Grey!” Crow folds his arms, wearing a wide, confident grin. His hair is down, which, in his bruised and beaten state gives him a bit of an ‘outcast warrior’ look that belies his likely level of injury. “You have no idea how glad I am to see you.”

“Were you not the one that wanted to bail as soon as things got bad?” Aelriss asks, looking at Crow over her shoulder as she moves to stand before you. The fringe of her cloak is in tatters, and she’s got rough cuts on her lower lip and beneath her eye.

“They’re a pair of Artifact users!” Crow sighs. “I had total faith in them, you know – I was just keeping the best interests of the group in mind.”

Tatsumaki gives a subdued groan.

“What they’re trying to say is that we’re happy you made it, Ascheritte.” Smith shakes his head. “I’m told that you succeeded in completing our mission, no less?”

“It’s all taken care of.” Freya says. “We met with a powerful foe, but Ascheritte’s protection was more than adequate for me to take the necessary actions.”

“What happened to your arm?” Aelriss asks, eyeing her suspiciously.

“To be honest?” Freya asks. The left sleeve of her garment is in tatters, and her arm – starting at the seal etched into her palm – is burned black, darker than her ashen skin, all the way to the elbow, terminating in a mess of strange, swirling figures like lapping flames. “I’m not entirely sure, though I am somehow eager to find out.”

> “Bigger issue: How are we getting back upstairs?”
> Message someone else.
> Write-in.

comment:
“Sorry about all of the trouble, guys. I’ll watch my step next time and whatnot, but we’ve got bigger issues I think.” You make eye contact with each of them in turn. “How do we get back upstairs?”

> [[ UI Messenger – Crimson Guardian Liza ]]
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Yo.
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Situation report?
> [[ Crimson Guardian Liza ]]: Regrouping and assessing.
> [[ Crimson Guardian Liza ]]: I’m not sure what’s happened, but what Exiles aren’t scattering seem to have gone catatonic.
> [[ Crimson Guardian Liza ]]: There’s no way we could have prepared adequately for those numbers, though.
> [[ Crimson Guardian Liza ]]: I don’t have a body count, but we’ve suffered a lot of losses.
> [[ Crimson Guardian Liza ]]: Report from your front?
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: It’s done.
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: What’s happened is that the rift has been closed – with Freya’s help, no less.
> [[ Crimson Guardian Liza ]]: …
> [[ Crimson Guardian Liza ]]: How?
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Her Artifact had something to do with it. She met with us, and was able to seal it shut with her ability.
> [[ Crimson Guardian Liza ]]: I don’t trust it.
> [[ Crimson Guardian Liza ]]: Send me the location of the rift. You understand the importance of double-checking, correct?
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Will do.

“Tethiss’s Claw is a black spot on the best maps we’ve got.” Crow says. “There’s definitely a road to the top somewhere in there, but we’re not exactly in top combat shape – unless we wanted to stay on standby and watch Cat-Tats punch her way through everything in sight while the rest of us are bleeding out…”

“She was trying to help.” Aelriss barks. “You know anything about that?”

“What else have you got, Crow?” You ask. “My climbing-buff gear is cursed.”

“It’s that or the back roads: also rather uncharted, and almost certainly much worse going bottom-up than top-down.” He folds his arms. “No spiders, probably, but I can’t guarantee what is there.”

“This is how the best players die, you know.” Smith says. “From getting in too deep – landing in a location you shouldn’t be in with no way out. It’s never the fighting that kills; it’s the little mistakes, or what happens afterward…”

“Well,” Freya says. “Your confidence is appreciated, but do you mind keeping such thoughts to yourself for the time being? Crow, you’re the scout. What’s your suggestion?”

“We’ve got the advantage when it comes to scouting in either location. The Claw presents more obvious dangers, while the environment and lack of knowledge as to where we actually are is probably the biggest threat along the other route.” He says. “I’ll leave it up to you, but personally I don’t want to see another Araneid as long as I live.”

Aelriss scoffs – you know what she’s thinking: that might not be very long the way things are going.

> Write-in.
name: BSO

“What’s up, Scrapbook?” Crow asks.

“I’m talking to Liza now. The situation up top seems to be settling down, so we can afford to take our time.” You respond. “She’s sending a team down to carve us a route through Tethiss’s Claw.”

There’s a chill on the back of your neck. Your Artifact is ready for use.

“Fine by me.” Crow says, sitting on a stone ledge nearby and producing his UI holo-screen. “But fuck if I’m gonna talk about my feelings or something.”

Looks like you’re gonna be down here for a while.

comment:
“Ael.” You produce a Celestial Gem, barely able to hand it over to her in spite of all she’s done for you. It feels as if you’re parting with a piece of yourself. “I wanted to thank you for the save earlier.”

“Oh.” Aelriss responds, eyes sparkling as she accepts the gift with open palms. “T-thanks, Ashe.”

“Cute. I’m gonna have to start calling you Lovebird.” Crow says, not looking up from his screen. “You know, doves are a symbol of peace, which is pretty fitting for the pacifist in you…”

“Ever seen what happens when you attack a bird of paradise, Crow?” Tucking away the Gem, Aelriss folds her arms, looking over her shoulder at him. “You should try it sometime.”

“Oh, Tats – sorry if we caused you some trouble.” You ruffle her hair. “Like I said, I’ll try watching my step. We’re all alright now, right?”

“Mm.” She nods. “Okay.”

“Freya,” Smith says, “You said you met with a powerful foe, earlier?”

“Yeah, fought a boss.” You respond. “And a boss after the boss. This place is supposedly close to the Earthsea Promenade – we’re deeper than I think we think we are.”

“Closer now than ever to that place.” Freya adds.

“We’re still a long way off, you know.” Aelriss says. “The alliance guilds are still trying to accrue resources for the excavator, and Ayla’s tearing herself up over planning the build. That, and we need safety – this raid has proven how hard it is for us to get high numbers of people this far down.”

“Have the Observatory’s proprietors considered the possibility of teleportation, Ascheritte?” Smith asks.

“Haven’t even thought about it.” You respond. “But we’d need somewhere to go – an away base, or something, which means we’d need to find somewhere with an Altar to set up camp, as well as enough Gems to secure a facility.”

“Right next to you.” Crow chimes in. “You could take Tethiss’s Claw.”

You shudder. You could never plan such a thing, could you? What if she finds out?

“Do you know of a Precursor within, Crow?” Freya asks.

“Look on the forums, Lady – like I’m doing right now.” Crow responds, unperturbed. “What else would something called ‘Tethiss’ be in a place like this? Meanwhile, I’m thinking ‘great, a fucking spider queen, just what we need’.” He sighs. “Maybe I should join the Excavator project. This place sucks ass.”

comment:
“Anyone want to take on some of the mobs down here?” You ask. “We’ve still got a while to wait.”

“I think you’re gonna be on your own.” Crow says. “I’m spent, for one, and don’t feel like fighting for two. Don’t have the resources right now to recover from any slip-ups.”

“Tatsumaki will probably be eager to join you.” Smith says. “Tatsumaki?”

Tatsumaki nods.

“Ael?” You ask.

“Taking stock of the situation.” Aelriss says, now on her own UI as well. “Sorry – looks like there’s a lot going on. There’s a lot of picking up the pieces underway right now, since a lot of Players went down in the raid. Likewise, there’s some pretty huge arguments going on about bounty hunting that I’m trying to read; some controversial things are going on and people are starting to find it reprehensible.”

“Oh, lovely.” Smith sighs. “I can’t wait to see the Averron we’re going back to.”

“Whatever things are like up there,” Freya says, addressing them – though she seems to be looking at you. “It just means that those of us who remain are more important than ever.”

comment:
As you call upon Strife Memoriam once more, you feel for a moment as if you have faded into the background. Silently, you watch as civilization grows and flourishes around you; silently, you obey as a golden age begins.

Some find your existence abhorrent; you are a strange creature, they believe, given false life by a madman toying with the forces of the universe. They show no respect, though you bear the weight of their kingdom on your shouiders.

You feel neither disappointment nor shame. You feel nothing. It is not your purpose to feel.

> With the Memory of Ruby, temporarily attack from a distance with destructive energy from Strife Memoriam.
> While active, significantly increases the user’s physical effect on their environment, improving the ease of feats of strength. No effect on damage of attacks.
> Strife Memoriam remains inactive for a short time after reallocating equipped Memories.

The forums have become home to a lot of threads cataloguing players who’ve fallen; rendezvous attempts for players whose whereabouts are unknown after the raid, as well as the fates of rare items and named or handcrafted equipment lost to the underground are rather commonplace, it seems.

There are not a lot of success stories.

Certainly, new arrivals present with a given frequency – but even though identified players respawn as nameless after their death, they are not guaranteed to spawn in or anywhere near Averron. Judging by what you once read online – on an imageboard – they aren’t even guaranteed to respawn in a city territory. You’ve heard stories of some who’ve just been cast alone into the Underground.

You get the sense that Averron’s population is smaller. It’s quiet and somewhat somber. Liza has had Mendicant, who appears to be in charge of the Guardians’ PR, update the city at large with the current status of the raid and related business.

There’s no word on a means of restoring life to a fallen Player, though discussion suggests that people now believe not even Artifacts can do so. Requests for such Artifacts, in fact, seem to be rewarded with strange and unique messages from the ‘Celestials’.

It doesn’t take you long to find the thread Aelriss is speaking of, either. It seems trouble’s come from a number of sources, the ‘my-word-against-yours’ scenarios you noted when you first faced Anaximander notwithstanding. Though player-versus-player combat has thankfully grown much less common, this decrease has led to some who seek a source of justified bloodshed in a place where justice isn’t easy to find. An entire branch of the forums has emerged, devoted to the swift removal of ninja looters, player killers, trolls and anyone deemed at large to be ‘problematic’.
name: BSO

comment:
>>982292

Though doing so can’t be done anonymously, anyone could have a bounty placed on their head for any price.

You ration there’s no way to stop it, barring a single guild monopolizing control of entire zones and disabling PVP. Perhaps, you think, the power of Celestial Gems, in their luster and allure, could pose a different means of putting an end to it – though perhaps it’s these Gems that drives the Identified to hunt one another down in the first place.

You think about Candrence, the imposing Artifact user from the meeting at the Observatory before the raid. She's one of the esteemed bounty hunters - and it seemed she was quite proud of it. You're not sure about your place in any of this; you can't imagine what she'd have to say...

> [[ Contact Request: Kengo ]]

Your UI pings. A message window emerges in front of your browser.

> [[ UI Messenger – Kengo ]]
> [[ Kengo ]]: Yo.
> [[ Kengo ]]: You’re the guy that’s supposed to be waiting on me?
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Well, that’s what Liza said.
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: So, apparently.
> [[ Kengo ]]: Well we’re on our way down in a big way.
> [[ Kengo ]]: The spider-slaughter has already begun.
> [[ Kengo ]]: You are still pretty far underground though.
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: You don’t say?
> [[ Kengo ]]: Oh, hush.
> [[ Kengo ]]: Just give us a bit, mmk?
name: BSO
